revised_title: Crystal Structure and Properties of Caesium Antimonide
tldr: The authors investigated the crystal structure and properties of caesium antimonide, a highly efficient photo-emitter. They found it to be a normal valency intermetallic compound with a pseudo-body-centered cubic structure. The semi-conducting properties are explained by a filled Brillouin zone containing two electrons per atom. The crystal structure also suggests an acceptable mechanism for its photo-emissivity.
